steps.step: Make the roast chicken
Finely chop the garlic cloves. Using the flat side of the knife’s blade, scrape and chop and mash the garlic and 1/2 teaspoon of salt into a paste.

Pull off any excess fat surrounding the cavity of the chicken and discard it. Rinse and pat the chicken dry, inside and out, and place the chicken on a plate. Rub the chicken all over with 2 of the lemon quarters, then discard the lemon quarters.

Slip a finger under the chicken skin at the edge of the cavity and run it along the breasts and thighs to gently loosen the skin. Gently work a little of the garlic paste between the chicken skin and meat, being careful not to tear the skin and rubbing your hand along the surface of the skin to smooth the paste and push it past where you can reach with your hand.
In a small bowl, whisk together the vinegar, 2 tablespoons of the wine, the oil, paprika, cumin, black pepper, and oregano.

Place the chicken in a 2-gallon resealable bag or a baking dish and pour the marinade on top. Turn the bird several times to coat. Seal the bag or cover the chicken and refrigerate for 5 to 8 hours, turning the chicken once or twice if you think of it.
Preheat the oven to 425ºF (220°C). Adjust the oven rack to the middle position.

Transfer the chicken to a baking dish or heavy frying pan (see LC Note preceding the recipe), pouring the marinade into a small bowl and scraping any thick bits of spices that cling to the container into the bowl. Squeeze the 2 remaining lemon quarters into the cavity of the bird and toss the lemon quarters into the cavity. If desired, tie the legs together with kitchen string. Season the chicken all over with 1 teaspoon of salt. Set the reserved marinade aside.

Roast the bird in the oven for 15 minutes, then baste with some of the marinade. Reduce the heat to 375ºF (190°C) and continue to roast, basting every 20 minutes with the marinade and the pan juices, for an hour. Discard the marinade. Then roast for 15 minutes more, for a total of 1 1/2 hours, until the juices of the chicken run clear when the thigh is pierced with a fork and an instant-read thermometer inserted into the thickest part of the thigh reads 165ºF (74°C). Allow the chicken to rest for a few minutes after you remove it from the oven.Make the salad
A little while before you take the chicken from the oven, peel and halve each avocado.
Remove the pits and cube the avocados.

Place the avocados, onion, cilantro, lime juice, oil and a generous pinch of salt in a bowl and toss to coat the avocado with lime juice. Set aside to allow the flavors to meld.Get the food on the table

Transfer the chicken to a cutting board. If you have a fat separator, now’s the time to use it. If you don’t have one, tip the baking dish so you can see the oil separating from the pan juices. Using a soup spoon, skim off and discard most of the oil.
Place the baking dish over medium-high heat and bring the juices to a simmer.

Add the remaining wine and simmer, scraping any bits from the bottom and sides of the dish, simmer for 3 minutes. (If your baking dish isn’t flameproof, pour the juices into a saucepan and proceed with the simmering.)1
Carve the bird, toss the avocado salad once again, and pour the pan sauce into a serving bowl to pass on the side.

ingredients.original: 2 tablespoons finely chopped fresh cilantro leaves, or to taste

ingredients.originalName: finely chopped fresh cilantro leaves, or to taste

results.title: Seared Steak Salad with Creamy Avocado Dressing

steps.step: In a blender or food processor, combine avocado, cilantro, lime juice, olive oil, and salt. Process until smooth. Dressing will be thick.In a large skillet or saute pan, heat oil over medium heat.

Add onions and saute for 5 minutes.Season steak with salt and pepper. Increase heat to medium-high, push onions to the sides of the pan and add the steak. Sear for 5 minutes a side —until golden brown— for medium-rare (6 minutes a side for medium).
Remove to a carving board and allow to rest for 5 minutes.

Add 2 tablespoons of water to the pan with the onions and scrape the bottom with a wooden spoon to remove the browned bits leftover by the steak. Once water has absorbed, remove the onions and set aside. Carve the sirloin into 1/4-inch slices.In a large bowl, combine dressing, lettuce, corn, tomatoes, bell pepper, and radishes; toss to combine. Divide between 4 plates and lay 4 slices of sirloin and a spoonful of caramelized onions on top of each salad.
Garnish with cilantro and a spoonful of queso fresco; serve.

ingredients.name: cilantro leaves
ingredients.original: 1/4 cup cilantro leaves, plus more for garnish

ingredients.originalName: cilantro leaves, plus more for garnish

results.title: Grilled Swordfish Skewers with Coconut, Key Lime and Green Chile Sauce

steps.step: Watch how to make this recipe.
Special equipment: 16 to 20 wooden skewers, soaked for 20 minutes
Place coconut milk, cream of coconut, key lime juice, serrano chile, ginger, and lime zest in a blender and blend until smooth; with the motor running, slowly add the oil and blend until emulified.
Pour the mixture into a bowl and fold in the coconut and cilantro. Season with salt and pepper, to taste.
Heat grill to high. Skewer 1 piece of swordfish onto each skewer.

Brush swordfish on both sides with oil and season with salt and pepper. Grill swordfish for 4 to 5 minutes on each side or until just cooked through. Spoon some of the sauce onto a platter and top with the skewers.
Drizzle some more of the sauce lightly over the swordfish and garnish with coconut flakes and cilantro.

ingredients.original: 2 tablespoons sweetened cream of coconut (recommended: Coco Lopez)

ingredients.originalName: sweetened cream of coconut (recommended: Coco Lopez)

ingredients.original: 1/4 cup fresh or bottled key lime juice
ingredients.originalString: 1/4 cup fresh or bottled key lime juice
ingredients.originalName: fresh or bottled key lime juice

ingredients.name: lime zest
ingredients.original: 2 teaspoons finely chopped fresh lime zest
ingredients.originalString: 2 teaspoons finely chopped fresh lime zest

steps.step: Add al ingredients to a shaker, add ice. Shake 30 seconds. Strain into a chilled martini glass.
Garnish with lime.
Add al ingredients to a shaker, add ice. Shake 30 seconds. Strain into a chilled martini glass.

Roast the peppers and garlic in a heavy bottomed pan until the start to blacken in spots, about 5-10 minutes, turning frequently.After the garlic has cooled, peel it and puree it along with the chilies and lime juice in a blender or food processor.Season with salt to taste.

Roast the peppers and garlic in a heavy bottomed pan until the start to blacken in spots, about 5-10 minutes, turning frequently.After the garlic has cooled, peel it and puree it along with the chilies and lime juice in a blender or food processor.Season with salt to taste.
